result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian I. Charbarneau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing on Revocation - 11/03/2016
revoked

11:48 a.m. Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer/Voorhees/Court discussion on cases being revoked - revocation packet not clear - Judge states pg 6 of revocation packet is clear that only revocation matter for today is 14cf232. Pfeifer/Voorhees/Court statement on sentencing. Stipulation by parties regarding jail credit. 
Court sentence
Jail - 9 months with Huber for all purposes.
Jail credit - 235 days
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment. 
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 12:04 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 3, 2016 at 11:30 am.
includes revocation summary and cover letter
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
modification to conditions of probation -additional 60 days jail  - granted by Court
to modify probation conditions

Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Calling 15cf44,14cm422 and 14cf232
11:07
15CF44 - State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, - Granted
14CF232 - State moves to amend to 940.225(3m) - class A mis.  -Granted
14cm422 - State moves to dismiss- Granted
Michlig statement to victim notification - 
Voorhees statement - Plea questionnaire filed- NO contest plea to count 1 as charged in 15cf44 and 14CF232 as amended -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Michlig/Voorhees - request report of Sept evaluation all ready in file be considered as sentencing exhibit- /Defendant/Court statement to sentencing
15cf44 - Court imposes and stays 5 years WSP and POP For 5 years
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNAAS/ Restitution of $766.59 which includes surcharge - Undergo any mental health counseling deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any recommendations/ Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
14CF232 - Court WHS and POP for  2 years- CC
CC/CV/Supervision fees/ undergo mental health counseling as deemed appropriate by PO - any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Appeal rights/voting rights/WEDS given to defendant - eligible for both CIP/ERP
Pre-trial conference at 12-09-2015 11:00 am

Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf232, 15cf44 and 14cm422. Not called on record - Defendant in prison - Michlig to file Writ to transport for next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
re psychiatric report
from defense counsel to Dr. Berney
for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Called w/15cf44.

11:28 am - Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf44 (Initial), 14cm422, 14cf232 (PTC).  In 15cf44 - In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.  Voorhees statement to 14cm422 and 14cf232.  Voorhees raises mental health/disabilty issues.  Psych evaluation needs to be completed for 14cf232 and 14cm422.  Court will order a psychiatrict exam of defendant by Dr. Kent Berney, PhD.  Court quashes writ.   MIchlig/Voorhees to bond.  Court sets sig bond. Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Adjourned 11:41 a.m.
from Atty Voorhees requesting new date for pretrial conference

10:46 a.m. Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees. Steven Mitchell Michlig. Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CM422. Voorhees statement--defendant's probation & extended supervsion revoked/in custody; seeking further neuro psych testing; requests adjournment. Michlig no objection. Court statement; grants adjournment. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued

03:06 pm - Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty plea due to mental disease/defect.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 10:45 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:40 PM - Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ian I. Charbarneau in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Detective James Adams/Sworn/Direct by Michlig - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Voorhees.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
no contact w/C.R.G., no contact with any female(s) under the age of 18
